column2: intènde; qŭi dedúcis vèlut ovem Joséfum. Qŭi sèdes super cherubína
column3: manifestáre. ^ O thou that rulest Israel
column4: give ear; thou that leadest Joseph like a sheep. Thou that sittest upon the cherubim
et vèni ut salvos fácias nos. ^ Before Ephraim
column6: and Manasseh stir up thy might

column2: ¿~qŭoúsqŭe irásceris super oratiónem sèrvi tui~? ^ O Lord God of hosts
column3: how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy servant~?

column2: et pótum dabis nobîs in lácrimîs in mensúra~? ^ How long wilt thou feed us with the bread of tears
column3: and give us for our drink tears in measure~?

column1: 7 ^ posuìsti nos in contradictiónem vicínîs nostrîs
column2: et inimíci nostri subsannavérunt nos. ^ Thou hast made us to be a contradiction to our neighbours
column3: and our enemies have scoffed at us.

column4: et salvi èrimus. ^ O God of hosts

column1: 9 ^ Víneam de Aegìpto transtulìsti~; ejecìsti gèntes
column2: et plantavìsti eam. ^ Thou hast brought a vineyard out of Egypt~; thou hast cast out the Gentiles and planted it.

column1: 10 ^ Dux itìneris fuìsti in conspèctu ejus~; plantavìsti radíces ejus
column2: et implévit terram. ^ Thou wast the guide of its journey in its sight~; thou plantedst the roots thereof
et arbústa ejus cedros Dei. ^ The shadow of it covered the hills
column3: and the branches thereof the cedars of God.

column1: 12 ^ Extèndit pálmites suos usqŭe ad mare
column2: et usqŭe ad flumen propágines ejus. ^ It stretched forth its branches unto the sea
column3: and its boughs unto the river.

column2: et vindémiant eam òmnes qŭi praĕtergrediùntur viam~? ^ Why hast thou broken down the hedge thereof
column3: so that all they who pass by the way do pluck it~?

column2: et singuláris fèrus depástus est eam. ^ The boar from the wood hath laid it waste
column3: and a singular wild beast hath devoured it.

column6: be turned back~; look down from heaven

column1: 16 ^ et pèrfice eam qŭam plantávit dèxtera tua
column2: et super fílium hòminis qŭem confirmavìsti tìbi. ^ and perfect the same which thy right hand hath planted
column3: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself.

column1: 17 ^ Incènsa ìgni et suffòssa~; ab increpatióne vùltûs tui períbunt. ^ It is burned with fire and dug up~; at the rebuke of thy countenance they shall perish.
18 ^ Fiat manus tua super vìrum dèxteraĕ tuaĕ
column3: qŭem confirmavìsti tìbi. ^ Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand
column4: and upon the son of man whom thou hast confirmed for thyself.

column1: 19 ^ Et non discédimus a te~; vivificábis nos
column2: et nomen tuum invocábimus. ^ And we depart not from thee~; thou shalt quicken us
column3: and we will call upon thy name.

column4: et salvi èrimus. ^ O Lord God of hosts
